member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyEventSubscriptionRequest.Enabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Enabled.
A Boolean value; set to true to activate the subscription.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyEventSubscriptionRequest.EventCategories
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EventCategories.
A list of event categories for a source type that you want to subscribe to. Use the DescribeEventCategories action to see a list of event categories.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyEventSubscriptionRequest.SnsTopicArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SnsTopicArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic created for event notification. The ARN is created by Amazon SNS when you create a topic and subscribe to it.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyEventSubscriptionRequest.SourceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceType.
The type of DMS resource that generates the events you want to subscribe to.
Valid values: replication-instance | replication-task

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyEventSubscriptionRequest.SubscriptionName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SubscriptionName.
The name of the DMS event notification subscription to be modified.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyEventSubscriptionResponse.EventSubscription
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EventSubscription.
The modified event subscription.

member.name: T:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyReplicationInstanceRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ModifyReplicationInstance operation. Modifies the replication instance to apply new settings. You can change one or more parameters by specifying these parameters and the new values in the request.
Some settings are applied during the maintenance window.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyReplicationInstanceRequest.AllocatedStorage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AllocatedStorage.
The amount of storage (in gigabytes) to be allocated for the replication instance.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyReplicationInstanceRequest.AllowMajorVersionUpgrade
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AllowMajorVersionUpgrade.
Indicates that major version upgrades are allowed. Changing this parameter does not result in an outage, and the change is asynchronously applied as soon as possible.
This parameter must be set to true when specifying a value for the EngineVersion parameter that is a different major version than the replication instance's current version.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyReplicationInstanceRequest.ApplyImmediately
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ApplyImmediately.
Indicates whether the changes should be applied immediately or during the next maintenance window.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyReplicationInstanceRequest.AutoMinorVersionUpgrade
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AutoMinorVersionUpgrade.
A value that indicates that minor version upgrades are applied automatically to the replication instance during the maintenance window. Changing this parameter doesn't result in an outage, except in the case described following. The change is asynchronously applied as soon as possible.
An outage does result if these factors apply:
This parameter is set to true during the maintenance window.
A newer minor version is available.
DMS has enabled automatic patching for the given engine version.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyReplicationInstanceRequest.EngineVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EngineVersion.
The engine version number of the replication instance.
When modifying a major engine version of an instance, also set AllowMajorVersionUpgrade to true.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyReplicationInstanceRequest.MultiAZ
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MultiAZ.
Specifies whether the replication instance is a Multi-AZ deployment. You can't set the AvailabilityZone parameter if the Multi-AZ parameter is set to true.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyReplicationInstanceRequest.PreferredMaintenanceWindow
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PreferredMaintenanceWindow.
The weekly time range (in UTC) during which system maintenance can occur, which might result in an outage. Changing this parameter does not result in an outage, except in the following situation, and the change is asynchronously applied as soon as possible. If moving this window to the current time, there must be at least 30 minutes between the current time and end of the window to ensure pending changes are applied.
Default: Uses existing setting
Format: ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi
Valid Days: Mon | Tue | Wed | Thu | Fri | Sat | Sun
Constraints: Must be at least 30 minutes

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyReplicationInstanceRequest.ReplicationInstanceArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReplicationInstanceArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication instance.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyReplicationInstanceRequest.ReplicationInstanceClass
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReplicationInstanceClass.
The compute and memory capacity of the replication instance as defined for the specified replication instance class. For example to specify the instance class dms.c4.large, set this parameter to "dms.c4.large".
For more information on the settings and capacities for the available replication instance classes, see Selecting the right DMS replication instance for your migration.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyReplicationInstanceRequest.ReplicationInstanceIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReplicationInstanceIdentifier.
The replication instance identifier. This parameter is stored as a lowercase string.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyReplicationInstanceRequest.VpcSecurityGroupIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VpcSecurityGroupIds.
Specifies the VPC security group to be used with the replication instance. The VPC security group must work with the VPC containing the replication instance.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyReplicationInstanceResponse.ReplicationInstance
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReplicationInstance.
The modified replication instance.

member.name: T:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyReplicationSubnetGroupRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ModifyReplicationSubnetGroup operation. Modifies the settings for the specified replication subnet group.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyReplicationSubnetGroupRequest.ReplicationSubnetGroupDescription
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReplicationSubnetGroupDescription.
A description for the replication instance subnet group.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyReplicationSubnetGroupRequest.ReplicationSubnetGroupIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReplicationSubnetGroupIdentifier.
The name of the replication instance subnet group.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyReplicationSubnetGroupRequest.SubnetIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SubnetIds.
A list of subnet IDs.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyReplicationSubnetGroupResponse.ReplicationSubnetGroup
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReplicationSubnetGroup.
The modified replication subnet group.

member.name: T:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyReplicationTaskRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ModifyReplicationTask operation. Modifies the specified replication task.
You can't modify the task endpoints. The task must be stopped before you can modify it.
For more information about DMS tasks, see Working with Migration Tasks in the Database Migration Service User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyReplicationTaskRequest.CdcStartPosition
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CdcStartPosition.
Indicates when you want a change data capture (CDC) operation to start. Use either CdcStartPosition or CdcStartTime to specify when you want a CDC operation to start. Specifying both values results in an error.
The value can be in date, checkpoint, or LSN/SCN format.
Date Example: --cdc-start-position “2018-03-08T12:12:12”
Checkpoint Example: --cdc-start-position "checkpoint:V1#27#mysql-bin-changelog.157832:1975:-1:2002:677883278264080:mysql-bin-changelog.157832:1876#0#0#*#0#93"
LSN Example: --cdc-start-position “mysql-bin-changelog.000024:373”
When you use this task setting with a source PostgreSQL database, a logical replication slot should already be created and associated with the source endpoint. You can verify this by setting the slotName extra connection attribute to the name of this logical replication slot. For more information, see Extra Connection Attributes When Using PostgreSQL as a Source for DMS.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyReplicationTaskRequest.CdcStartTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CdcStartTime.
Indicates the start time for a change data capture (CDC) operation. Use either CdcStartTime or CdcStartPosition to specify when you want a CDC operation to start. Specifying both values results in an error.
Timestamp Example: --cdc-start-time “2018-03-08T12:12:12”

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyReplicationTaskRequest.CdcStopPosition
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CdcStopPosition.
Indicates when you want a change data capture (CDC) operation to stop. The value can be either server time or commit time.
Server time example: --cdc-stop-position “server_time:2018-02-09T12:12:12”
Commit time example: --cdc-stop-position “commit_time: 2018-02-09T12:12:12 “

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyReplicationTaskRequest.MigrationType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MigrationType.
The migration type. Valid values: full-load | cdc | full-load-and-cdc

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyReplicationTaskRequest.ReplicationTaskArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReplicationTaskArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication task.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyReplicationTaskRequest.ReplicationTaskIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReplicationTaskIdentifier.
The replication task identifier.
Constraints:
Must contain 1-255 alphanumeric characters or hyphens.
First character must be a letter.
Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyReplicationTaskRequest.ReplicationTaskSettings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReplicationTaskSettings.
JSON file that contains settings for the task, such as task metadata settings.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyReplicationTaskRequest.TableMappings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TableMappings.
When using the CLI or boto3, provide the path of the JSON file that contains the table mappings. Precede the path with file://. For example, --table-mappings file://mappingfile.json. When working with the DMS API, provide the JSON as the parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyReplicationTaskRequest.TaskData
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TaskData.
Supplemental information that the task requires to migrate the data for certain source and target endpoints. For more information, see Specifying Supplemental Data for Task Settings in the Database Migration Service User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ModifyReplicationTaskResponse.ReplicationTask
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReplicationTask.
The replication task that was modified.

member.name: T:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MongoDbSettings
member.summary: Provides information that defines a MongoDB endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MongoDbSettings.AuthMechanism
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AuthMechanism.
The authentication mechanism you use to access the MongoDB source endpoint.
For the default value, in MongoDB version 2.x, "default" is "mongodb_cr". For MongoDB version 3.x or later, "default" is "scram_sha_1". This setting isn't used when AuthType is set to "no".

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MongoDbSettings.AuthSource
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AuthSource.
The MongoDB database name. This setting isn't used when AuthType is set to "no".
The default is "admin".

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MongoDbSettings.AuthType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AuthType.
The authentication type you use to access the MongoDB source endpoint.
When when set to "no", user name and password parameters are not used and can be empty.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MongoDbSettings.DatabaseName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DatabaseName.
The database name on the MongoDB source endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MongoDbSettings.DocsToInvestigate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocsToInvestigate.
Indicates the number of documents to preview to determine the document organization. Use this setting when NestingLevel is set to "one".
Must be a positive value greater than 0. Default value is 1000.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MongoDbSettings.ExtractDocId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExtractDocId.
Specifies the document ID. Use this setting when NestingLevel is set to "none".
Default value is "false".

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MongoDbSettings.KmsKeyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KmsKeyId.
The KMS key identifier that is used to encrypt the content on the replication instance. If you don't specify a value for the KmsKeyId parameter, then DMS uses your default encryption key. KMS creates the default encryption key for your Amazon Web Services account. Your Amazon Web Services account has a different default encryption key for each Amazon Web Services Region.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MongoDbSettings.NestingLevel
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NestingLevel.
Specifies either document or table mode.
Default value is "none". Specify "none" to use document mode. Specify "one" to use table mode.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MongoDbSettings.Password
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Password.
The password for the user account you use to access the MongoDB source endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MongoDbSettings.Port
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Port.
The port value for the MongoDB source endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MongoDbSettings.SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn.
The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access the value in SecretsManagerSecret. The role must allow the iam:PassRole action. SecretsManagerSecret has the value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows access to the MongoDB endpoint.
You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You can specify the values for this setting and SecretsManagerSecretId. Or you can specify clear-text values for UserName, Password, ServerName, and Port. You can't specify both. For more information on creating this SecretsManagerSecret and the SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn and SecretsManagerSecretId required to access it, see Using secrets to access Database Migration Service resources in the Database Migration Service User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MongoDbSettings.SecretsManagerSecretId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecretsManagerSecretId.
The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the SecretsManagerSecret that contains the MongoDB endpoint connection details.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MongoDbSettings.ServerName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerName.
The name of the server on the MongoDB source endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MongoDbSettings.Username
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Username.
The user name you use to access the MongoDB source endpoint.

member.name: T:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MoveReplicationTaskRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the MoveReplicationTask operation. Moves a replication task from its current replication instance to a different target replication instance using the specified parameters. The target replication instance must be created with the same or later DMS version as the current replication instance.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MoveReplicationTaskRequest.ReplicationTaskArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReplicationTaskArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the task that you want to move.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MoveReplicationTaskRequest.TargetReplicationInstanceArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TargetReplicationInstanceArn.
The ARN of the replication instance where you want to move the task to.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MoveReplicationTaskResponse.ReplicationTask
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReplicationTask.
The replication task that was moved.

member.name: T:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MySQLSettings
member.summary: Provides information that defines a MySQL endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MySQLSettings.AfterConnectScript
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AfterConnectScript.
Specifies a script to run immediately after DMS connects to the endpoint. The migration task continues running regardless if the SQL statement succeeds or fails.
For this parameter, provide the code of the script itself, not the name of a file containing the script.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MySQLSettings.CleanSourceMetadataOnMismatch
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CleanSourceMetadataOnMismatch.
Adjusts the behavior of DMS when migrating from an SQL Server source database that is hosted as part of an Always On availability group cluster. If you need DMS to poll all the nodes in the Always On cluster for transaction backups, set this attribute to false.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MySQLSettings.DatabaseName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DatabaseName.
Database name for the endpoint. For a MySQL source or target endpoint, don't explicitly specify the database using the DatabaseName request parameter on either the CreateEndpoint or ModifyEndpoint API call. Specifying DatabaseName when you create or modify a MySQL endpoint replicates all the task tables to this single database. For MySQL endpoints, you specify the database only when you specify the schema in the table-mapping rules of the DMS task.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MySQLSettings.EventsPollInterval
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EventsPollInterval.
Specifies how often to check the binary log for new changes/events when the database is idle.
Example: eventsPollInterval=5;
In the example, DMS checks for changes in the binary logs every five seconds.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MySQLSettings.MaxFileSize
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxFileSize.
Specifies the maximum size (in KB) of any .csv file used to transfer data to a MySQL-compatible database.
Example: maxFileSize=512

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MySQLSettings.ParallelLoadThreads
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ParallelLoadThreads.
Improves performance when loading data into the MySQL-compatible target database. Specifies how many threads to use to load the data into the MySQL-compatible target database. Setting a large number of threads can have an adverse effect on database performance, because a separate connection is required for each thread.
Example: parallelLoadThreads=1

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MySQLSettings.Password
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Password.
Endpoint connection password.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MySQLSettings.Port
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Port.
Endpoint TCP port.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MySQLSettings.SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn.
The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access the value in SecretsManagerSecret. The role must allow the iam:PassRole action. SecretsManagerSecret has the value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows access to the MySQL endpoint.
You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You can specify the values for this setting and SecretsManagerSecretId. Or you can specify clear-text values for UserName, Password, ServerName, and Port. You can't specify both. For more information on creating this SecretsManagerSecret and the SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn and SecretsManagerSecretId required to access it, see Using secrets to access Database Migration Service resources in the Database Migration Service User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MySQLSettings.SecretsManagerSecretId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecretsManagerSecretId.
The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the SecretsManagerSecret that contains the MySQL endpoint connection details.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MySQLSettings.ServerName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerName.
Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MySQLSettings.ServerTimezone
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerTimezone.
Specifies the time zone for the source MySQL database.
Example: serverTimezone=US/Pacific;
Note: Do not enclose time zones in single quotes.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MySQLSettings.TargetDbType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TargetDbType.
Specifies where to migrate source tables on the target, either to a single database or multiple databases.
Example: targetDbType=MULTIPLE_DATABASES

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.MySQLSettings.Username
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Username.
Endpoint connection user name.

member.name: T:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.NeptuneSettings
member.summary: Provides information that defines an Amazon Neptune endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.NeptuneSettings.ErrorRetryDuration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ErrorRetryDuration.
The number of milliseconds for DMS to wait to retry a bulk-load of migrated graph data to the Neptune target database before raising an error. The default is 250.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.NeptuneSettings.IamAuthEnabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IamAuthEnabled.
If you want Identity and Access Management (IAM) authorization enabled for this endpoint, set this parameter to true. Then attach the appropriate IAM policy document to your service role specified by ServiceAccessRoleArn. The default is false.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.NeptuneSettings.MaxFileSize
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxFileSize.
The maximum size in kilobytes of migrated graph data stored in a .csv file before DMS bulk-loads the data to the Neptune target database. The default is 1,048,576 KB. If the bulk load is successful, DMS clears the bucket, ready to store the next batch of migrated graph data.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.NeptuneSettings.MaxRetryCount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxRetryCount.
The number of times for DMS to retry a bulk load of migrated graph data to the Neptune target database before raising an error. The default is 5.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.NeptuneSettings.S3BucketFolder
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3BucketFolder.
A folder path where you want DMS to store migrated graph data in the S3 bucket specified by S3BucketName

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.NeptuneSettings.S3BucketName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3BucketName.
The name of the Amazon S3 bucket where DMS can temporarily store migrated graph data in .csv files before bulk-loading it to the Neptune target database. DMS maps the SQL source data to graph data before storing it in these .csv files.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.NeptuneSettings.ServiceAccessRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServiceAccessRoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the service role that you created for the Neptune target endpoint. The role must allow the iam:PassRole action. For more information, see Creating an IAM Service Role for Accessing Amazon Neptune as a Target in the Database Migration Service User Guide.

member.name: T:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings
member.summary: Provides information that defines an Oracle endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.AccessAlternateDirectly
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccessAlternateDirectly.
Set this attribute to false in order to use the Binary Reader to capture change data for an Amazon RDS for Oracle as the source. This tells the DMS instance to not access redo logs through any specified path prefix replacement using direct file access.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.AdditionalArchivedLogDestId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AdditionalArchivedLogDestId.
Set this attribute with ArchivedLogDestId in a primary/ standby setup. This attribute is useful in the case of a switchover. In this case, DMS needs to know which destination to get archive redo logs from to read changes. This need arises because the previous primary instance is now a standby instance after switchover.
Although DMS supports the use of the Oracle RESETLOGS option to open the database, never use RESETLOGS unless necessary. For additional information about RESETLOGS, see RMAN Data Repair Concepts in the Oracle Database Backup and Recovery User's Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.AddSupplementalLogging
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AddSupplementalLogging.
Set this attribute to set up table-level supplemental logging for the Oracle database. This attribute enables PRIMARY KEY supplemental logging on all tables selected for a migration task.
If you use this option, you still need to enable database-level supplemental logging.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.AllowSelectNestedTables
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AllowSelectNestedTables.
Set this attribute to true to enable replication of Oracle tables containing columns that are nested tables or defined types.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.ArchivedLogDestId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ArchivedLogDestId.
Specifies the ID of the destination for the archived redo logs. This value should be the same as a number in the dest_id column of the v$archived_log view. If you work with an additional redo log destination, use the AdditionalArchivedLogDestId option to specify the additional destination ID. Doing this improves performance by ensuring that the correct logs are accessed from the outset.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.ArchivedLogsOnly
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ArchivedLogsOnly.
When this field is set to Y, DMS only accesses the archived redo logs. If the archived redo logs are stored on Oracle ASM only, the DMS user account needs to be granted ASM privileges.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.AsmPassword
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AsmPassword.
For an Oracle source endpoint, your Oracle Automatic Storage Management (ASM) password. You can set this value from the asm_user_password value. You set this value as part of the comma-separated value that you set to the Password request parameter when you create the endpoint to access transaction logs using Binary Reader. For more information, see Configuration for change data capture (CDC) on an Oracle source database.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.AsmServer
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AsmServer.
For an Oracle source endpoint, your ASM server address. You can set this value from the asm_server value. You set asm_server as part of the extra connection attribute string to access an Oracle server with Binary Reader that uses ASM. For more information, see Configuration for change data capture (CDC) on an Oracle source database.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.AsmUser
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AsmUser.
For an Oracle source endpoint, your ASM user name. You can set this value from the asm_user value. You set asm_user as part of the extra connection attribute string to access an Oracle server with Binary Reader that uses ASM. For more information, see Configuration for change data capture (CDC) on an Oracle source database.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.CharLengthSemantics
P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.DatabaseName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DatabaseName.
Database name for the endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.DirectPathNoLog
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DirectPathNoLog.
When set to true, this attribute helps to increase the commit rate on the Oracle target database by writing directly to tables and not writing a trail to database logs.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.DirectPathParallelLoad
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DirectPathParallelLoad.
When set to true, this attribute specifies a parallel load when useDirectPathFullLoad is set to Y. This attribute also only applies when you use the DMS parallel load feature. Note that the target table cannot have any constraints or indexes.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.EnableHomogenousTablespace
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EnableHomogenousTablespace.
Set this attribute to enable homogenous tablespace replication and create existing tables or indexes under the same tablespace on the target.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.ExtraArchivedLogDestIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExtraArchivedLogDestIds.
Specifies the IDs of one more destinations for one or more archived redo logs. These IDs are the values of the dest_id column in the v$archived_log view. Use this setting with the archivedLogDestId extra connection attribute in a primary-to-single setup or a primary-to-multiple-standby setup.
This setting is useful in a switchover when you use an Oracle Data Guard database as a source. In this case, DMS needs information about what destination to get archive redo logs from to read changes. DMS needs this because after the switchover the previous primary is a standby instance. For example, in a primary-to-single standby setup you might apply the following settings.
archivedLogDestId=1; ExtraArchivedLogDestIds=[2]
In a primary-to-multiple-standby setup, you might apply the following settings.
archivedLogDestId=1; ExtraArchivedLogDestIds=[2,3,4]
Although DMS supports the use of the Oracle RESETLOGS option to open the database, never use RESETLOGS unless it's necessary. For more information about RESETLOGS, see RMAN Data Repair Concepts in the Oracle Database Backup and Recovery User's Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.FailTasksOnLobTruncation
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FailTasksOnLobTruncation.
When set to true, this attribute causes a task to fail if the actual size of an LOB column is greater than the specified LobMaxSize.
If a task is set to limited LOB mode and this option is set to true, the task fails instead of truncating the LOB data.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.NumberDatatypeScale
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NumberDatatypeScale.
Specifies the number scale. You can select a scale up to 38, or you can select FLOAT. By default, the NUMBER data type is converted to precision 38, scale 10.
Example: numberDataTypeScale=12

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.OraclePathPrefix
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OraclePathPrefix.
Set this string attribute to the required value in order to use the Binary Reader to capture change data for an Amazon RDS for Oracle as the source. This value specifies the default Oracle root used to access the redo logs.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.ParallelAsmReadThreads
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ParallelAsmReadThreads.
Set this attribute to change the number of threads that DMS configures to perform a change data capture (CDC) load using Oracle Automatic Storage Management (ASM). You can specify an integer value between 2 (the default) and 8 (the maximum). Use this attribute together with the readAheadBlocks attribute.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.Password
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Password.
Endpoint connection password.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.Port
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Port.
Endpoint TCP port.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.ReadAheadBlocks
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReadAheadBlocks.
Set this attribute to change the number of read-ahead blocks that DMS configures to perform a change data capture (CDC) load using Oracle Automatic Storage Management (ASM). You can specify an integer value between 1000 (the default) and 200,000 (the maximum).

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.ReadTableSpaceName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReadTableSpaceName.
When set to true, this attribute supports tablespace replication.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.ReplacePathPrefix
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReplacePathPrefix.
Set this attribute to true in order to use the Binary Reader to capture change data for an Amazon RDS for Oracle as the source. This setting tells DMS instance to replace the default Oracle root with the specified usePathPrefix setting to access the redo logs.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.RetryInterval
P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn.
The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access the value in SecretsManagerSecret. The role must allow the iam:PassRole action. SecretsManagerSecret has the value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows access to the Oracle endpoint.
You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You can specify the values for this setting and SecretsManagerSecretId. Or you can specify clear-text values for UserName, Password, ServerName, and Port. You can't specify both. For more information on creating this SecretsManagerSecret and the SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn and SecretsManagerSecretId required to access it, see Using secrets to access Database Migration Service resources in the Database Migration Service User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.SecretsManagerOracleAsmAccessRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecretsManagerOracleAsmAccessRoleArn.
Required only if your Oracle endpoint uses Advanced Storage Manager (ASM). The full ARN of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access the SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecret. This SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecret has the secret value that allows access to the Oracle ASM of the endpoint.
You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You can specify the values for this setting and SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecretId. Or you can specify clear-text values for AsmUserName, AsmPassword, and AsmServerName. You can't specify both. For more information on creating this SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecret and the SecretsManagerOracleAsmAccessRoleArn and SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecretId required to access it, see Using secrets to access Database Migration Service resources in the Database Migration Service User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecretId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecretId.
Required only if your Oracle endpoint uses Advanced Storage Manager (ASM). The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the SecretsManagerOracleAsmSecret that contains the Oracle ASM connection details for the Oracle endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.SecretsManagerSecretId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecretsManagerSecretId.
The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the SecretsManagerSecret that contains the Oracle endpoint connection details.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.SecurityDbEncryption
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecurityDbEncryption.
For an Oracle source endpoint, the transparent data encryption (TDE) password required by AWM DMS to access Oracle redo logs encrypted by TDE using Binary Reader. It is also the TDE_Password part of the comma-separated value you set to the Password request parameter when you create the endpoint. The SecurityDbEncryptian setting is related to this SecurityDbEncryptionName setting. For more information, see Supported encryption methods for using Oracle as a source for DMS in the Database Migration Service User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.SecurityDbEncryptionName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecurityDbEncryptionName.
For an Oracle source endpoint, the name of a key used for the transparent data encryption (TDE) of the columns and tablespaces in an Oracle source database that is encrypted using TDE. The key value is the value of the SecurityDbEncryption setting. For more information on setting the key name value of SecurityDbEncryptionName, see the information and example for setting the securityDbEncryptionName extra connection attribute in Supported encryption methods for using Oracle as a source for DMS in the Database Migration Service User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.ServerName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerName.
Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.SpatialDataOptionToGeoJsonFunctionName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SpatialDataOptionToGeoJsonFunctionName.
Use this attribute to convert SDO_GEOMETRY to GEOJSON format. By default, DMS calls the SDO2GEOJSON custom function if present and accessible. Or you can create your own custom function that mimics the operation of SDOGEOJSON and set SpatialDataOptionToGeoJsonFunctionName to call it instead.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.StandbyDelayTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StandbyDelayTime.
Use this attribute to specify a time in minutes for the delay in standby sync. If the source is an Oracle Active Data Guard standby database, use this attribute to specify the time lag between primary and standby databases.
In DMS, you can create an Oracle CDC task that uses an Active Data Guard standby instance as a source for replicating ongoing changes. Doing this eliminates the need to connect to an active database that might be in production.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.UseAlternateFolderForOnline
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UseAlternateFolderForOnline.
Set this attribute to true in order to use the Binary Reader to capture change data for an Amazon RDS for Oracle as the source. This tells the DMS instance to use any specified prefix replacement to access all online redo logs.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.UseBFile
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UseBFile.
Set this attribute to Y to capture change data using the Binary Reader utility. Set UseLogminerReader to N to set this attribute to Y. To use Binary Reader with Amazon RDS for Oracle as the source, you set additional attributes. For more information about using this setting with Oracle Automatic Storage Management (ASM), see Using Oracle LogMiner or DMS Binary Reader for CDC.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.UseDirectPathFullLoad
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UseDirectPathFullLoad.
Set this attribute to Y to have DMS use a direct path full load. Specify this value to use the direct path protocol in the Oracle Call Interface (OCI). By using this OCI protocol, you can bulk-load Oracle target tables during a full load.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.UseLogminerReader
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UseLogminerReader.
Set this attribute to Y to capture change data using the Oracle LogMiner utility (the default). Set this attribute to N if you want to access the redo logs as a binary file. When you set UseLogminerReader to N, also set UseBfile to Y. For more information on this setting and using Oracle ASM, see Using Oracle LogMiner or DMS Binary Reader for CDC in the DMS User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.UsePathPrefix
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UsePathPrefix.
Set this string attribute to the required value in order to use the Binary Reader to capture change data for an Amazon RDS for Oracle as the source. This value specifies the path prefix used to replace the default Oracle root to access the redo logs.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OracleSettings.Username
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Username.
Endpoint connection user name.

member.name: T:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OrderableReplicationInstance
member.summary: In response to the DescribeOrderableReplicationInstances operation, this object describes an available replication instance. This description includes the replication instance's type, engine version, and allocated storage.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OrderableReplicationInstance.AvailabilityZones
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AvailabilityZones.
List of Availability Zones for this replication instance.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OrderableReplicationInstance.DefaultAllocatedStorage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DefaultAllocatedStorage.
The default amount of storage (in gigabytes) that is allocated for the replication instance.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OrderableReplicationInstance.EngineVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EngineVersion.
The version of the replication engine.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OrderableReplicationInstance.IncludedAllocatedStorage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IncludedAllocatedStorage.
The amount of storage (in gigabytes) that is allocated for the replication instance.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OrderableReplicationInstance.MaxAllocatedStorage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxAllocatedStorage.
The minimum amount of storage (in gigabytes) that can be allocated for the replication instance.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OrderableReplicationInstance.MinAllocatedStorage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MinAllocatedStorage.
The minimum amount of storage (in gigabytes) that can be allocated for the replication instance.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OrderableReplicationInstance.ReleaseStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReleaseStatus.
The value returned when the specified EngineVersion of the replication instance is in Beta or test mode. This indicates some features might not work as expected.
DMS supports the ReleaseStatus parameter in versions 3.1.4 and later.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OrderableReplicationInstance.ReplicationInstanceClass
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReplicationInstanceClass.
The compute and memory capacity of the replication instance as defined for the specified replication instance class. For example to specify the instance class dms.c4.large, set this parameter to "dms.c4.large".
For more information on the settings and capacities for the available replication instance classes, see Selecting the right DMS replication instance for your migration.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.OrderableReplicationInstance.StorageType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StorageType.
The type of storage used by the replication instance.

member.name: T:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.PendingMaintenanceAction
member.summary: Describes a maintenance action pending for an DMS resource, including when and how it will be applied. This data type is a response element to the DescribePendingMaintenanceActions operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.PendingMaintenanceAction.Action
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Action.
The type of pending maintenance action that is available for the resource.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.PendingMaintenanceAction.AutoAppliedAfterDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AutoAppliedAfterDate.
The date of the maintenance window when the action is to be applied. The maintenance action is applied to the resource during its first maintenance window after this date. If this date is specified, any next-maintenance opt-in requests are ignored.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.PendingMaintenanceAction.CurrentApplyDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CurrentApplyDate.
The effective date when the pending maintenance action will be applied to the resource. This date takes into account opt-in requests received from the ApplyPendingMaintenanceAction API operation, and also the AutoAppliedAfterDate and ForcedApplyDate parameter values. This value is blank if an opt-in request has not been received and nothing has been specified for AutoAppliedAfterDate or ForcedApplyDate.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.PendingMaintenanceAction.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
A description providing more detail about the maintenance action.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.PendingMaintenanceAction.ForcedApplyDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ForcedApplyDate.
The date when the maintenance action will be automatically applied. The maintenance action is applied to the resource on this date regardless of the maintenance window for the resource. If this date is specified, any immediate opt-in requests are ignored.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.PendingMaintenanceAction.OptInStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OptInStatus.
The type of opt-in request that has been received for the resource.

member.name: T:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.PostgreSQLSettings
member.summary: Provides information that defines a PostgreSQL endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.PostgreSQLSettings.AfterConnectScript
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AfterConnectScript.
For use with change data capture (CDC) only, this attribute has DMS bypass foreign keys and user triggers to reduce the time it takes to bulk load data.
Example: afterConnectScript=SET session_replication_role='replica'

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.PostgreSQLSettings.CaptureDdls
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CaptureDdls.
To capture DDL events, DMS creates various artifacts in the PostgreSQL database when the task starts. You can later remove these artifacts.
If this value is set to N, you don't have to create tables or triggers on the source database.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.PostgreSQLSettings.DatabaseName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DatabaseName.
Database name for the endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.PostgreSQLSettings.DdlArtifactsSchema
P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.PostgreSQLSettings.ExecuteTimeout
P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.PostgreSQLSettings.FailTasksOnLobTruncation
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FailTasksOnLobTruncation.
When set to true, this value causes a task to fail if the actual size of a LOB column is greater than the specified LobMaxSize.
If task is set to Limited LOB mode and this option is set to true, the task fails instead of truncating the LOB data.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.PostgreSQLSettings.HeartbeatEnable
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HeartbeatEnable.
The write-ahead log (WAL) heartbeat feature mimics a dummy transaction. By doing this, it prevents idle logical replication slots from holding onto old WAL logs, which can result in storage full situations on the source. This heartbeat keeps restart_lsn moving and prevents storage full scenarios.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.PostgreSQLSettings.HeartbeatFrequency
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HeartbeatFrequency.
Sets the WAL heartbeat frequency (in minutes).

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.PostgreSQLSettings.HeartbeatSchema
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HeartbeatSchema.
Sets the schema in which the heartbeat artifacts are created.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.PostgreSQLSettings.MaxFileSize
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxFileSize.
Specifies the maximum size (in KB) of any .csv file used to transfer data to PostgreSQL.
Example: maxFileSize=512

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.PostgreSQLSettings.Password
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Password.
Endpoint connection password.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.PostgreSQLSettings.PluginName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PluginName.
Specifies the plugin to use to create a replication slot.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.PostgreSQLSettings.Port
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Port.
Endpoint TCP port.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.PostgreSQLSettings.SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn.
The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access the value in SecretsManagerSecret. The role must allow the iam:PassRole action. SecretsManagerSecret has the value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows access to the PostgreSQL endpoint.
You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You can specify the values for this setting and SecretsManagerSecretId. Or you can specify clear-text values for UserName, Password, ServerName, and Port. You can't specify both. For more information on creating this SecretsManagerSecret and the SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn and SecretsManagerSecretId required to access it, see Using secrets to access Database Migration Service resources in the Database Migration Service User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.PostgreSQLSettings.SecretsManagerSecretId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecretsManagerSecretId.
The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the SecretsManagerSecret that contains the PostgreSQL endpoint connection details.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.PostgreSQLSettings.ServerName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerName.
Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.PostgreSQLSettings.SlotName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SlotName.
Sets the name of a previously created logical replication slot for a change data capture (CDC) load of the PostgreSQL source instance.
When used with the CdcStartPosition request parameter for the DMS API , this attribute also makes it possible to use native CDC start points. DMS verifies that the specified logical replication slot exists before starting the CDC load task. It also verifies that the task was created with a valid setting of CdcStartPosition. If the specified slot doesn't exist or the task doesn't have a valid CdcStartPosition setting, DMS raises an error.
For more information about setting the CdcStartPosition request parameter, see Determining a CDC native start point in the Database Migration Service User Guide. For more information about using CdcStartPosition, see CreateReplicationTask, StartReplicationTask, and ModifyReplicationTask.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.PostgreSQLSettings.Username
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Username.
Endpoint connection user name.

member.name: T:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RebootReplicationInstanceRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the RebootReplicationInstance operation. Reboots a replication instance. Rebooting results in a momentary outage, until the replication instance becomes available again.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RebootReplicationInstanceRequest.ForceFailover
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ForceFailover.
If this parameter is true, the reboot is conducted through a Multi-AZ failover. If the instance isn't configured for Multi-AZ, then you can't specify true. ( --force-planned-failover and --force-failover can't both be set to true.)

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RebootReplicationInstanceRequest.ForcePlannedFailover
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ForcePlannedFailover.
If this parameter is true, the reboot is conducted through a planned Multi-AZ failover where resources are released and cleaned up prior to conducting the failover. If the instance isn''t configured for Multi-AZ, then you can't specify true. ( --force-planned-failover and --force-failover can't both be set to true.)

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RebootReplicationInstanceRequest.ReplicationInstanceArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReplicationInstanceArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication instance.

member.name: T:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RebootReplicationInstanceResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the RebootReplicationInstance operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RebootReplicationInstanceResponse.ReplicationInstance
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReplicationInstance.
The replication instance that is being rebooted.

member.name: T:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedisSettings
member.summary: Provides information that defines a Redis target endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedisSettings.AuthPassword
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AuthPassword.
The password provided with the auth-role and auth-token options of the AuthType setting for a Redis target endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedisSettings.AuthType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AuthType.
The type of authentication to perform when connecting to a Redis target. Options include none, auth-token, and auth-role. The auth-token option requires an AuthPassword value to be provided. The auth-role option requires AuthUserName and AuthPassword values to be provided.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedisSettings.AuthUserName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AuthUserName.
The user name provided with the auth-role option of the AuthType setting for a Redis target endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedisSettings.Port
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Port.
Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) port for the endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedisSettings.ServerName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerName.
Fully qualified domain name of the endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedisSettings.SslCaCertificateArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SslCaCertificateArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the certificate authority (CA) that DMS uses to connect to your Redis target endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedisSettings.SslSecurityProtocol
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SslSecurityProtocol.
The connection to a Redis target endpoint using Transport Layer Security (TLS). Valid values include plaintext and ssl-encryption. The default is ssl-encryption. The ssl-encryption option makes an encrypted connection. Optionally, you can identify an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for an SSL certificate authority (CA) using the SslCaCertificateArn setting. If an ARN isn't given for a CA, DMS uses the Amazon root CA.
The plaintext option doesn't provide Transport Layer Security (TLS) encryption for traffic between endpoint and database.

member.name: T:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedshiftSettings
member.summary: Provides information that defines an Amazon Redshift endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedshiftSettings.AcceptAnyDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AcceptAnyDate.
A value that indicates to allow any date format, including invalid formats such as 00/00/00 00:00:00, to be loaded without generating an error. You can choose true or false (the default).
This parameter applies only to TIMESTAMP and DATE columns. Always use ACCEPTANYDATE with the DATEFORMAT parameter. If the date format for the data doesn't match the DATEFORMAT specification, Amazon Redshift inserts a NULL value into that field.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedshiftSettings.AfterConnectScript
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AfterConnectScript.
Code to run after connecting. This parameter should contain the code itself, not the name of a file containing the code.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedshiftSettings.BucketFolder
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BucketFolder.
An S3 folder where the comma-separated-value (.csv) files are stored before being uploaded to the target Redshift cluster.
For full load mode, DMS converts source records into .csv files and loads them to the BucketFolder/TableID path. DMS uses the Redshift COPY command to upload the .csv files to the target table. The files are deleted once the COPY operation has finished. For more information, see COPY in the Amazon Redshift Database Developer Guide.
For change-data-capture (CDC) mode, DMS creates a NetChanges table, and loads the .csv files to this BucketFolder/NetChangesTableID path.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedshiftSettings.BucketName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BucketName.
The name of the intermediate S3 bucket used to store .csv files before uploading data to Redshift.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedshiftSettings.CaseSensitiveNames
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CaseSensitiveNames.
If Amazon Redshift is configured to support case sensitive schema names, set CaseSensitiveNames to true. The default is false.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedshiftSettings.CompUpdate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CompUpdate.
If you set CompUpdate to true Amazon Redshift applies automatic compression if the table is empty. This applies even if the table columns already have encodings other than RAW. If you set CompUpdate to false, automatic compression is disabled and existing column encodings aren't changed. The default is true.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedshiftSettings.ConnectionTimeout
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionTimeout.
A value that sets the amount of time to wait (in milliseconds) before timing out, beginning from when you initially establish a connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedshiftSettings.DatabaseName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DatabaseName.
The name of the Amazon Redshift data warehouse (service) that you are working with.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedshiftSettings.DateFormat
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DateFormat.
The date format that you are using. Valid values are auto (case-sensitive), your date format string enclosed in quotes, or NULL. If this parameter is left unset (NULL), it defaults to a format of 'YYYY-MM-DD'. Using auto recognizes most strings, even some that aren't supported when you use a date format string.
If your date and time values use formats different from each other, set this to auto.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedshiftSettings.EmptyAsNull
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EmptyAsNull.
A value that specifies whether DMS should migrate empty CHAR and VARCHAR fields as NULL. A value of true sets empty CHAR and VARCHAR fields to null. The default is false.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedshiftSettings.EncryptionMode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EncryptionMode.
The type of server-side encryption that you want to use for your data. This encryption type is part of the endpoint settings or the extra connections attributes for Amazon S3. You can choose either SSE_S3 (the default) or SSE_KMS.
For the ModifyEndpoint operation, you can change the existing value of the EncryptionMode parameter from SSE_KMS to SSE_S3. But you can’t change the existing value from SSE_S3 to SSE_KMS.
To use SSE_S3, create an Identity and Access Management (IAM) role with a policy that allows "arn:aws:s3:::*" to use the following actions: "s3:PutObject", "s3:ListBucket"

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedshiftSettings.ExplicitIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExplicitIds.
This setting is only valid for a full-load migration task. Set ExplicitIds to true to have tables with IDENTITY columns override their auto-generated values with explicit values loaded from the source data files used to populate the tables. The default is false.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedshiftSettings.FileTransferUploadStreams
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FileTransferUploadStreams.
The number of threads used to upload a single file. This parameter accepts a value from 1 through 64. It defaults to 10.
The number of parallel streams used to upload a single .csv file to an S3 bucket using S3 Multipart Upload. For more information, see Multipart upload overview.
FileTransferUploadStreams accepts a value from 1 through 64. It defaults to 10.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedshiftSettings.LoadTimeout
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LoadTimeout.
The amount of time to wait (in milliseconds) before timing out of operations performed by DMS on a Redshift cluster, such as Redshift COPY, INSERT, DELETE, and UPDATE.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedshiftSettings.MaxFileSize
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxFileSize.
The maximum size (in KB) of any .csv file used to load data on an S3 bucket and transfer data to Amazon Redshift. It defaults to 1048576KB (1 GB).

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedshiftSettings.Password
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Password.
The password for the user named in the username property.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedshiftSettings.Port
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Port.
The port number for Amazon Redshift. The default value is 5439.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedshiftSettings.RemoveQuotes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RemoveQuotes.
A value that specifies to remove surrounding quotation marks from strings in the incoming data. All characters within the quotation marks, including delimiters, are retained. Choose true to remove quotation marks. The default is false.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedshiftSettings.ReplaceChars
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReplaceChars.
A value that specifies to replaces the invalid characters specified in ReplaceInvalidChars, substituting the specified characters instead. The default is "?".

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedshiftSettings.ReplaceInvalidChars
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReplaceInvalidChars.
A list of characters that you want to replace. Use with ReplaceChars.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedshiftSettings.SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn.
The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that specifies DMS as the trusted entity and grants the required permissions to access the value in SecretsManagerSecret. The role must allow the iam:PassRole action. SecretsManagerSecret has the value of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that allows access to the Amazon Redshift endpoint.
You can specify one of two sets of values for these permissions. You can specify the values for this setting and SecretsManagerSecretId. Or you can specify clear-text values for UserName, Password, ServerName, and Port. You can't specify both. For more information on creating this SecretsManagerSecret and the SecretsManagerAccessRoleArn and SecretsManagerSecretId required to access it, see Using secrets to access Database Migration Service resources in the Database Migration Service User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedshiftSettings.SecretsManagerSecretId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecretsManagerSecretId.
The full ARN, partial ARN, or friendly name of the SecretsManagerSecret that contains the Amazon Redshift endpoint connection details.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedshiftSettings.ServerName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerName.
The name of the Amazon Redshift cluster you are using.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedshiftSettings.ServerSideEncryptionKmsKeyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerSideEncryptionKmsKeyId.
The KMS key ID. If you are using SSE_KMS for the EncryptionMode, provide this key ID. The key that you use needs an attached policy that enables IAM user permissions and allows use of the key.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedshiftSettings.ServiceAccessRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServiceAccessRoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that has access to the Amazon Redshift service. The role must allow the iam:PassRole action.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedshiftSettings.TimeFormat
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TimeFormat.
The time format that you want to use. Valid values are auto (case-sensitive), 'timeformat_string', 'epochsecs', or 'epochmillisecs'. It defaults to 10. Using auto recognizes most strings, even some that aren't supported when you use a time format string.
If your date and time values use formats different from each other, set this parameter to auto.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedshiftSettings.TrimBlanks
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TrimBlanks.
A value that specifies to remove the trailing white space characters from a VARCHAR string. This parameter applies only to columns with a VARCHAR data type. Choose true to remove unneeded white space. The default is false.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedshiftSettings.TruncateColumns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TruncateColumns.
A value that specifies to truncate data in columns to the appropriate number of characters, so that the data fits in the column. This parameter applies only to columns with a VARCHAR or CHAR data type, and rows with a size of 4 MB or less. Choose true to truncate data. The default is false.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedshiftSettings.Username
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Username.
An Amazon Redshift user name for a registered user.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RedshiftSettings.WriteBufferSize
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property WriteBufferSize.
The size (in KB) of the in-memory file write buffer used when generating .csv files on the local disk at the DMS replication instance. The default value is 1000 (buffer size is 1000KB).

member.name: T:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.RefreshSchemasRequest

Default value is data-reload.

member.name: T:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ReplicationTask
member.summary: Provides information that describes a replication task created by the CreateReplicationTask operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ReplicationTask.CdcStartPosition
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CdcStartPosition.
Indicates when you want a change data capture (CDC) operation to start. Use either CdcStartPosition or CdcStartTime to specify when you want the CDC operation to start. Specifying both values results in an error.
The value can be in date, checkpoint, or LSN/SCN format.
Date Example: --cdc-start-position “2018-03-08T12:12:12”
Checkpoint Example: --cdc-start-position "checkpoint:V1#27#mysql-bin-changelog.157832:1975:-1:2002:677883278264080:mysql-bin-changelog.157832:1876#0#0#*#0#93"
LSN Example: --cdc-start-position “mysql-bin-changelog.000024:373”

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ReplicationTask.CdcStopPosition
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CdcStopPosition.
Indicates when you want a change data capture (CDC) operation to stop. The value can be either server time or commit time.
Server time example: --cdc-stop-position “server_time:2018-02-09T12:12:12”
Commit time example: --cdc-stop-position “commit_time: 2018-02-09T12:12:12 “

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ReplicationTask.LastFailureMessage

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ReplicationTask.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status of the replication task. This response parameter can return one of the following values:
"moving" – The task is being moved in response to running the MoveReplicationTask operation.
"creating" – The task is being created in response to running the CreateReplicationTask operation.
"deleting" – The task is being deleted in response to running the DeleteReplicationTask operation.
"failed" – The task failed to successfully complete the database migration in response to running the StartReplicationTask operation.
"failed-move" – The task failed to move in response to running the MoveReplicationTask operation.
"modifying" – The task definition is being modified in response to running the ModifyReplicationTask operation.
"ready" – The task is in a ready state where it can respond to other task operations, such as StartReplicationTask or DeleteReplicationTask .
"running" – The task is performing a database migration in response to running the StartReplicationTask operation.
"starting" – The task is preparing to perform a database migration in response to running the StartReplicationTask operation.
"stopped" – The task has stopped in response to running the StopReplicationTask operation.
"stopping" – The task is preparing to stop in response to running the
StopReplicationTask operation.
"testing" – The database migration specified for this task is being tested in response to running either the StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun or the StartReplicationTaskAssessment operation.
StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun is an improved premigration task assessment operation. The StartReplicationTaskAssessment operation assesses data type compatibility only between the source and target database of a given migration task. In contrast,
StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun enables you to specify a variety of premigration task assessments in addition to data type compatibility. These assessments include ones for the validity of primary key definitions and likely issues with database migration performance, among others.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ReplicationTask.StopReason
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StopReason.
The reason the replication task was stopped. This response parameter can return one of the following values:
"STOP_REASON_FULL_LOAD_COMPLETED" – Full-load migration completed.
"STOP_REASON_CACHED_CHANGES_APPLIED" – Change data capture (CDC) load completed.
"STOP_REASON_CACHED_CHANGES_NOT_APPLIED" – In a full-load and CDC migration, the full load stopped as specified before starting the CDC migration.
"STOP_REASON_SERVER_TIME" – The migration stopped at the specified server time.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ReplicationTask.TableMappings

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun.ServiceAccessRoleArn
member.summary:

ARN of the service role used to start the assessment run using the StartReplicationTaskAssessmentRun operation. The role must allow the iam:PassRole action.

member.name: P:Amazon.DatabaseMigrationService.Model.ReplicationTaskAssessmentRun.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
Assessment run status.
This status can have one of the following values:
"cancelling" – The assessment run was canceled by the CancelReplicationTaskAssessmentRun operation.
"deleting" – The assessment run was deleted by the DeleteReplicationTaskAssessmentRun operation.
"failed" – At least one individual assessment completed with a failed status.
"error-provisioning" – An internal error occurred while resources were provisioned (during provisioning status).
"error-executing" – An internal error occurred while individual assessments ran (during running status).
"invalid state" – The assessment run is in an unknown state.
"passed" – All individual assessments have completed, and none has a failed status.
"provisioning" – Resources required to run individual assessments are being provisioned.
"running" – Individual assessments are being run.
"starting" – The assessment run is starting, but resources are not yet being provisioned for individual assessments.
